meta_description: Iowa Quilt Museum • Promoting appreciation of the American quilt and the art of quiltmaking. Located in Winterset, home of the Covered Bridges of Madison County
hours_text:
### The Iowa Quilt Museum features rotating exhibits of historic and contemporary quilts.

### Every visit is a brand new experience!

[Current Exhibit](https://www.iowaquiltmuseum.org/current-exhibits/) [Future Exhibits](https://www.iowaquiltmuseum.org/future-exhibits/)

### Museum Hours

Touring the museum usually takes about 45 minutes, depending on whether or not you want to read all of the signage.

**April 1 – October 31**  
10:00 – 5:00 Monday– Saturday  
12:00 – 4:00 Sunday

**November 1 – March 31**  
10:00 – 4:00 Monday– Saturday  
12:00 – 4:00 Sunday

  * Closed on Thanksgiving Day, Christmas Day, New Year’s Day, Easter Sunday and the Fourth of July.
  * Closing at 1:00 on Thanksgiving Eve, Christmas Eve and New Year’s Eve.
  * If Winterset Community Schools close for inclement weather, we will also close.

### Admission Fee

  * **$12 for Adults**
  * **$10 for Seniors, Veterans and Active Military**
  * **$5 for Children (ages 3-12)**
  * **$5 for Students (including undergraduate and graduate) with ID**
  * **Free** **for Iowa[Quilt Museum Members](https://www.iowaquiltmuseum.org/membership/ "Become a Supporting Member of the IQM") and NARM Members**
  * **Group rates – see below**

### Group Tours

  * Admission for groups of 20 or more is $8 per person.
  * In order to have adequate staff on hand, we appreciate advanced notice for group tours.

### Guided Tours

  * Groups can schedule a guided gallery walk with Marianne Fons. 
  * Cost is $150 per group. 
  *...

collections_text:
### The Iowa Quilt Museum welcomes quilters, quilt lovers, history buffs, and all appreciators of American art and culture. 

### Our mission is to promote appreciation of the American quilt and the art of quilting through displays of quilts and information about quilt history.

## Our Current Exhibit

[Learn More](https://www.iowaquiltmuseum.org/current-exhibits/)

# Online Lecture Series!

## Three-Part Virtual Lecture Series

#### with Diane L. Murtha

Join us online for an engaging lecture series with **award-winning quilter, author, and international instructor Diane L. Murtha** , hosted by the Iowa Quilt Museum

**Challenge Accepted: Expanding Your Creative Boundaries, January 24 | 2:00–3:00 PM**  
Diane combines her popular “Challenges I & II” into one insightful, humorous session. Discover how quilt challenges can build your skills and spark new creative energy.

**Peaceful Stitching, February 21 | 2:00–3:00 PM**  
Learn how to incorporate slow stitching techniques—like big stitch quilting, embroidery, and decorative darning—into your quilting practice for both creative and meditative benefits.

**License to Play, March 21 | 2:00–3:00 PM**  
From modifying a pattern to designing your own, Diane offers fun, fearless strategies to help you unlock your creative potential.  
  
**Cost:**  
• $20 per session  
• Or **$50 for all three**  
**This is a virtual event** —attend from anywhere!  
Your participation directly supports the Iowa Quilt Museum and helps us continue sh...
